title: Communication Noise Management Strategies for Educational Materials

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts and Experience with Digital Learning Environments
context.additional_context: Program for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to improve mathematical problem-solving abilities, emphasizing real-world application through project-based assessment.

learning_goals: Learners can identify three major types of communication noise (semantic errors, factual errors, transmission errors) occurring in educational materials
Learners can systematically diagnose noise elements in mathematics textbooks using content analysis techniques and classify them with over 80% accuracy
Learners can apply calibration strategies to minimize noise in project-based assessments, improving final output quality by over 40%
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
